results.title: The Vital link
results.creator_credit: M.J. Clark, W. J. Allen and Rank Audio Visual
results.brief_description: Examines the development of transport routes, how the preferred means of transport is usually a compromise between convenience, speed and cost and some of the problems caused by an ever increasing dependence on transport in our everyday lives.
results.creator_credit_for_label: M.J. Clark, W. J. Allen and Rank Audio Visual

results.title: The UN is for you
results.brief_description:
Gives a general introduction to the UN, a brief history of the reasons for its establishment, and an overview of the functions and work of its various organs. Includes the role of the Security Council, UNICEF, FAO and the General Assembly. It is realistic in that it indicates that the UN is not able to solve all problems but that its value is as a forum to air disagreements.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Budgeting (NP)
results.brief_description: Shows the essentials of business budgeting, explains how to construct a budget and why it is such an important management tool. Provides clear and colourful graphics with animated sequences. Features John Cleese. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: Shout it out numbers
results.brief_description: Uses animated geometric shapes and music to illustrate numbers from one to ten. Triangles, circles, and squares transform into animals, trains, suns, see-saws and other familiar objects.

results.title: Short tall story
results.creator_credit: John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: Charming allegorical film about the role of the United Nations in resolving disputes: Separated by a bank of cloud, the short people and tall people are becoming increasingly ill-disposed to each other. Failing to resolve the dispute on their own, the U.N. Fairy is enlisted to their aid, and the cloud dividing the conflicting parties are driven aside.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films

results.title: The Mole and the lollipop
results.brief_description: Cleaning up the litter made by two candy-eating children, Mole finds a lollipop they left behind. Not knowing what it is, Mole demonstrates great inventiveness in trying to discover its purpose. An animated program without narration.

results.title: Maps: how to read them
results.creator_credit: Sal Bruno, BFA Educational Media and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: This film uses excellent graphics and animation to explain the concepts of map projection and latitude and longitude, to show how symbols are used on maps, and the importance of scale, legend, key, the compass role and grid references in map reading.

results.title: Abraham Lincoln. - 2nd edition.
results.creator_credit: Kathy Tallon, Scott Craig and Scott Craig Productions
results.brief_description: Beginning with the statement that Lincoln became the “last victim of the Civil War”, when he was assassinated, the film traces his life from humble beginnings in a log cabin, an axe wielding woodsman and also voracious reader as a youth, to candidate to the State Assembly at twenty-three in 1832. However, the film gives no hint of criticism of Lincoln, who spoke “with courage and conviction for all people”, and no analysis of the causes of events or action is attempted.

results.title: Fatal compromise
results.creator_credit: Josef Gemes and MAFILM Pannonia Filmstudio
results.brief_description: A superbly animated production that details the lengths to which a love-smitten hedgehog will go in order to gain the attention of a rather large feline character. However the hedgehog does not quite get what it bargained for. Suitable for primary school level.
results.description: A superbly animated production that details the lengths to which a love-smitten hedgehog will go in order to gain the attention of a rather large feline character. However the hedgehog does not quite get what it bargained for. Suitable for primary school level.
